remedies.usage: Drink Â½ cup twice daily for 3 days.
remedies.warnings: Avoid during pregnancy. May cause nausea if overused.

remedies.usage: Apply gel on forehead and temples every 2 hours.
remedies.warnings: Do not ingest for children under 5. Avoid open wounds.

remedies.preparation: Chew a small piece of bark (size of a pea).
Boil 10g of crushed roots in 3 cups of water for 15 minutes.
remedies.usage: Drink 1 cup every 6 hours until symptoms subside.
remedies.warnings: Consult a doctor if fever persists beyond 2 days.

remedies.preparation: Crush fresh leaves and inhale the scent.
remedies.usage: Inhale for 5 minutes. Repeat after 1 hour if needed.
remedies.warnings: May trigger allergies in sensitive individuals.

remedies.preparation: Grind fresh leaves into a paste.
remedies.usage: Apply directly to the wound and cover with a clean cloth.

remedies.preparation: Chew a small piece of the bark.
remedies.usage: Hold near the affected tooth for 5 minutes.
remedies.warnings: Spit out saliva; do not swallow.

remedies.preparation: Mix crushed berries with coconut oil.
remedies.usage: Apply thinly to the rash twice daily.
remedies.warnings: Test on a small skin area first. Avoid eyes.

remedies.preparation: Steep 3 fresh leaves in hot water for 5 minutes.
Warm the leaves and tie them over the painful area.
remedies.warnings: Do not apply on broken skin.
